gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: NOAA JPSS Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite (VIIRS) Sea Ice Characterization (SIC) Environmental Data Record (EDR) from IDPS

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: STAR project landing page.

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This dataset contains an Environmental Data Record (EDR) of Sea Ice Characterization (SIC) from the Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite (VIIRS) instrument onboard the Suomi-NPP satellite and is produced by the NOAA Environmental Satellite, Data, and Information Service (NESDIS). The VIIRS SIC EDR provides ice classifications for ice free, new/young age, and other ice at a spatial resolution of 750 meters at nadir for both day and night over oceans poleward of 36 degrees north and 50 degrees south. The SIC algorithm requires accurate inputs from the VIIRS Sea Ice Concentration Intermediate Product (IP) and the VIIRS Cloud Mask (VCM) IP. By default, IDPS VIIRS EDRs obtained from the Comprehensive Large-Array Stewardship System (CLASS) are distributed in four aggregated 86-second granules in Hierarchical Data Format v.5 (HDF5) with metadata attributes included.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The VIIRS Sea Ice Characterization (SIC) EDR can be used to map ice extent and to determine sea ice age. These variables are essential for polar maritime navigation and are needed for accurate ice extent charting.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCEI > National Centers for Environmental Information, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:fileDescription.gco:CharacterString: Example of the VIIRS Sea Ice Characterization (SIC) EDR over the Northern Hemisphere. Image courtesy of the STAR Ice Team.

gmd:keyword.gco:CharacterString: Earth Science > Oceans > Sea Ice > Sea Ice Age

gmd:other.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA created the National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) by merging NOAA's National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), and National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC), including the National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC), per the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, Public Law 113-235. NCEI launched publicly on April 22, 2015.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Bulk metadata change applied on 2018-05-25. See version control repository history for metadata change details.
